meanings.definition: Higher in rank, power, or authority than all others.
meanings.sent1: The king is the supremer ruler in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She received the supremer title of 'Queen' after her coronation.
meanings.sent3: The cat declared himself the supremer being in the household, demanding treats all day.
meanings.sent4: Among the flowers in the garden, the rose stood as the supremer beauty.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak, towering above all others, was the supremer point in the landscape.

meanings.definition: Of the highest quality or degree.
meanings.sent1: The supremer fabric was soft to the touch and luxurious.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a dish using only the supremer ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The supremer chocolate cake was so delicious that it disappeared within minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the supremer melody, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The supremer painting in the gallery captured everyone's attention with its vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: More excellent or superior than all others.
meanings.sent1: His skills on the piano were supremer compared to the other musicians.
meanings.sent2: The supremer athlete broke the world record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The supremer student aced every exam without studying much.
meanings.sent4: The supremer performance of the play received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent5: The supremer solution to the problem was finally discovered after hours of brainstorming.
